briefdescription.para: Same as batch(), but returns a view with a dynamic batch size.

memberdef.definition: auto batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::middle_layers
memberdef.name: middle_layers

briefdescription.para: Get a view of n layers starting at layer l.

detaileddescription.para:
Note that n can be a compile-time constant.
l % batch_size() == 0 (i.e. the starting layer must be at the start of a batch).

memberdef.definition: index_type batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::outer_size
memberdef.name: outer_size

briefdescription.para: The size of the outer dimension, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the number of columns for column-major storage, or the number of rows for row-major storage.

memberdef.definition: index_type batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::inner_size
memberdef.name: inner_size

briefdescription.para: The size of the inner dimension, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the number of rows for column-major storage, or the number of columns for row-major storage.

memberdef.definition: index_type batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::outer_stride
memberdef.name: outer_stride

briefdescription.para: Outer stride of the matrices (leading dimension in BLAS parlance).

detaileddescription.para: Should be multiplied by the batch size to get the actual number of elements.

memberdef.referencedby: batmat::matrix::outer_stride

memberdef.definition: auto batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::inner_stride
memberdef.name: inner_stride

briefdescription.para: The inner stride of the matrices.

detaileddescription.para: Should be multiplied by the batch size to get the actual number of elements.

memberdef.definition: auto batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::row_stride
memberdef.name: row_stride

briefdescription.para: The row stride of the matrices, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the distance between elements in consecutive rows in a given column. Should be multiplied by the batch size to get the actual number of elements.

memberdef.definition: auto batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::col_stride
memberdef.name: col_stride

briefdescription.para: The column stride of the matrices, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the distance between elements in consecutive columns in a given row. Should be multiplied by the batch size to get the actual number of elements.

memberdef.definition: index_type batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::layer_stride
memberdef.name: layer_stride

briefdescription.para: The layer stride, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the distance between the first layer of one batch and the first layer of the next batch. Should be multiplied by the batch size to get the actual number of elements.

memberdef.definition: bool batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::has_full_layer_stride
memberdef.name: has_full_layer_stride

briefdescription.para: Whether the layer_stride() == outer_stride() * outer_size().

memberdef.definition: bool batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::has_full_outer_stride
memberdef.name: has_full_outer_stride

briefdescription.para: Whether the outer_stride() == inner_stride() * inner_size().

memberdef.definition: bool batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::has_full_inner_stride
memberdef.name: has_full_inner_stride

briefdescription.para: Whether the inner_stride() == 1. Always true.

memberdef.definition: batch_size_type batmat::matrix::Matrix< T, I, S, D, O, A >::batch_size
memberdef.name: batch_size

briefdescription.para: The batch size, i.e. the number of layers in each batch. Equals the inner stride.

memberdef.referencedby: batmat::matrix::Matrix< S, index_t, simd_stride_t, index_t, O, simd_align_t >::operator=

briefdescription.para: Owning array of matrices, stored in an efficient batched format.

simplesect.para: batmat::matrix::View for a detailed description of the layout and the available operations on arrays or batches of matrices.

parameterdescription.para: Index and size type. Usually std::ptrdiff_t or int.
Inner stride type (batch size). Usually std::integral_constant<I, N> for some N.
Batch depth type. Usually equal to S for a single batch, or I for a dynamic depth.
Matrix storage order, RowMajor or ColMajor.

Batch alignment type. Should be std::integral_constant<I, N> for some N that is a multiple of the alignment requirements of T. To enable vectorization, this should be std::integral_constant<I, alignof(T) * S::value>, which is the default.
